reviews.text: Althought I consult reviews on TripAdvisor regularly, I rarely feel compelled to write a review, but our stay at The Mount Zion Hotel overlooking the Old City in Jerusalem was exceptional. From our first spectacular views of the Old City through the lovely arched windows, continuing into the well-appointed rooms, and breathtaking pool area, we were delighted to be guests of this special hotel. Breakfasts were delicious and robust (mind-boggling selections at the buffet - and all wonderful and fresh!), and the location is the best in Jerusalem. We loved sunsets and sunrises there, and the calm and beauty that the hotel offers guests. This was a particularly important trip for my family - it was celebrating our 13 year-old daughter's Bat Mitzvah at the Western Wall - and my husband, daughter, 10-year old son and I all agreed that this was our most favorite of all the many properties we have stayed with in Jerusalem. The staff was friendly and helpful, and Michal at the front-desk was always a delight! I strongly recommend the Mount Zion Hotel to my friends and business colleagues! I can't wait to stay there again and again!
reviews.title: Outstanding Hotel - location, service and quality...and beauty!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the only boutique hotel we stayed in during our visit to Israel, and it was quite nice overall.
reviews.title: Boutique Hotel in a Great location - Gorgeous Views!

reviews.text: Typical to Israel, staff at the property ranged from outright surly (when we checked in) to superb (helping us deal with a rental car debacle on our check out day).
reviews.title: Comfortable rooms - spectacular view

reviews.text: One word of caution - the taxi area in front of the hotel has some pretty aggressive cab drivers, even by Middle Eastern standards. The hotel occasionally reins them in, but be prepared to run through a phalanx of them when you go in and out the front door. They will also remember you each and every time you depart and do the normal sales pitch. It is good preparation for walking through the Old City shops. :)
reviews.title: Mount zion is overpriced
Stay there for a memorable experience
reviews.text: The location is absolutely magnificent - you have stellar views out on to the old city of Jerusalem, and you are only 15 minutes walking distance to the Jaffa gate and Tower of David Museum. This is perhaps one of the best features of the hotel, which you realize as you quickly walk past thousands of tour buses sitting in traffic on their way around the area to see the sites.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While other hotels in Jerusalem have an international feel about them and would not be out of place in any other city in the World, the Mount Zion Hotel has a special charm all of its own. We arrived from the airport at about 4.30 in the morning and our room was ready and waiting for us. with a view towards the walls of the Old City as the sun rose. What else could we ask for? A delightful breakfast each morning, sometimes in the air conditioned breakfast room and sometimes on the open terrace. A sort walk from the restaurants and coffee shops in the German Colony and an equally short walk past the Sultan's Pool and up the steep pathway into the Old City itself through the Zion Gate.
reviews.title: Real Jerusalem
This is an "uncomfotel" - Insist on a non-pygmy sized bed
reviews.text: A special mention for Michal, one of the reception staff, who took the time to help me reactivate my Israeli cellphone that had not been used for some time. It was thanks to her that Orange eventually let me use my old number again. Thanks Michal!

Beware of many of the taxi drivers who treat all guests from the hotel as 'friers' who should be taken for as much money as possible. Always insist that they switch on their meters and if they won't, just get out of the cab and wait for one that will. Check what they charge you on the meter receipt. Don't pay any supposed 'telephone request charge' that they put on if the hotel didn't call the cab for you.
reviews.title: large citadel suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, why does the hotel, like other hotels in Israel, insist on charging exorbitant amounts for wifi access? If you want wifi for free just go up to Emek Refaim in the German Colony, buy a coffee and browse to your hearty's content as part of the service.
reviews.title: coach roach haven !!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: Apart from the grouse about wifi access, if you want a beautiful, warm and welcoming hotel as your base for a visits to the Holy Sites, choose the Mount Zion. You won't be disappointed.
reviews.title: Beautiful location, unhelpful staff.

reviews.text: We stayed here on a tour so cannot comment on the value for the price and our tour price was very reasonable. Our room 596 had a patio and a beautiful view of the grounds and the old city but required the use of both elevators and stairs to get to. The beds, bath and tv were nothing special (in fact most of our tour group said "Are you kidding?" on first viewing the rooms. However, we spent very little time in our room The hotel is relatively close to the Old City (I like to walk but even the non walkers in our tour made it for shopping) and the King David Hotel, Mamila area, Jaffa Gate and German section. There were many nice early morning walks and good choices for dinner nearby. I loved the breakfast options even on the Sabbath when only cold foods were available-though liking cheese, bread and salads is a plus for breakfast in Israel-there are great eggs and fish too. For the views, location, and breakfast, I would recommend this hotel if the price is right. Internet was $10 for an hour but you could use the time all day from 8am to 11pm in segments. Pool was cold but nice in April.
reviews.title: Great views, location, breakfast-adequate rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in room 706 which is one of only 3 rooms with balconies (706 has the largest balcony). Although the hotel has elevators, the rooms with baclonies require climbing one flight of stairs. The views from the room's balcony of the Dormition and of Silwan are gorgeous and unbeatable. We paid $300 for this room. There was a welcome platter of fresh and dried fruit. The room's furniture was rather basic: twin beds which were very narrow (almost fell out of bed when tossing over), a small TV, a small refrigerator (no minibar), a closet with a safe, a couple of chairs and a tiny table. There were also a table and chairs on the balcony, and at our request we also got a parasol. The balcony's railing (Actually it's a wall) is approx'ly 4 feet high, which means that you need to stand in order to see the view. The bathroom was OK although there was some hair in the sink. The service was fair at best. While we were in our room, the door suddenly opened and in walked an employee and asked if we needed more towels... (I suppose it is possible that he had knocked and we didn't hear.) It was a big challenge to hook up to the wi fi system (additional fee), and my request that someone come up to our room to assist us was denied; after I finally hooked up, the signal kept going off. The swimming pool was wonderful, and the gardens leading to it are very lush. However, the swimming pool closes at 5 PM (Sunset is after 7 PM). We did not try the spa. Breakfast was fine, with the obligatory zillion different cheeses and herrings and olives. All considered, the price seemed rather steep, but I'd go back for that view. A word about the location: while it is possible to walk to the Old City and to downtown West Jerusalem, it is a good walk and you may prefer to take a taxi (There are no buses near the hotel).
reviews.title: Fantastic views

reviews.text: This hotel looks amazing. The views from the hotel lobby is amazing. Location is fantastic. Pleasantly greeted by security/front door. The rest of the staff (front desk, spa, pool, bar) seemed annoyed to have to work there. Annoyed to check in/out, explain services, distribute towels, etc. Internet is expensive. $6 per hour or $25 per day. Breakfast was good. Hotel pool only open until 5pm and it was freezing cold. Rooms were tiny. Loved the location but will look for another spot for our return visit. Business center was a joke.
reviews.title: Great location....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What can one say about this hotel?
reviews.title: A Barmitzvah in Jerusalem

reviews.text: The location is spot on within walking distance of the Jaffa gate and overlooking the walls of the old city with East Jerusalem in the back ground.
reviews.title: Perfect Hideaway in Jerusalem

reviews.text: This is a hotel on Mt Zion with a great view of the Old City. The rooms are renovated, clean and have middle eastern decor. Service was professional, solicitous and friendly. Breakfast was fantastic. Grounds and views are breathtakingly beautiful - probably the reason there were functions held there almost every night of our 6 day stay. That can be a problem however - due to noise from band. We were VERY disappointed that the pool closed at 5 pm - presumably this was because of the outdoor functions that took place on a terrace beside the pool and their desire not to have bathers within eyeshot of attendees of events. If you are touring Jerusalem in the warm months you'll find it a disappointment that you can't take a leisurely swim in the evening. Only other criticism is that some rooms require climbing half or whole staircase to access them (even though there is an elevator the rooms are not all on the same level on a particular floor) and not much choice in restaurants in the immediate area. However, a taxi can take you to great eating areas for 25-30 shekels.
reviews.title: Overall very positive

reviews.text: It is a very high quality hotel, no doubts about it. Also, it is very well situated. Re. the price - shop around. I came for the conference and then stayed over the weekend, so I was not comparing the hotels and was using the conference rate.
reviews.title: High quality, as it's obvious from the cost

reviews.text: Re. one rather unusual advantage - fastest laundry I have even seen. If you submit it in the evening, it's ready before nine. I.e. extremelly usefull for business travellers.
reviews.title: lovely views good breakfast,heloful staff. room need decorating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I did not really like the breakfast. The choice could have been better.
reviews.title: Good location but rooms can be tidier and need refurbishing

reviews.text: Also, the staff could not get their act together on minor subjects. I had a room with two beds and needed a double bed for the weekend when my spouse was comming over. At first, the staff told me that they will bring in a double matress to the room. But then they said I needed to move to a different room. I had nothing against it in the first place but it would have been nice to know in advance to build the plans around it.
reviews.title: Great Value - Only draw back is not near Old City
